input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: InfobloxNIOS.

Creates a new network in Infoblox Grid Manager.
Sample items Xml:
<items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network>10.0.0.0</network> <mask>24</mask> <comment>user comment</comment> <disable>true</disable> <authority>true</authority> <template>template_name</template> <auto-create-reversezone>true</auto-create-reversezone> <scheduled-at>2012-11-30T20:30:19+05:30</scheduled-at> <lease-settings> <lease-time>360</lease-time> <routers>10.0.0.1,10.0.0.2</routers> <domain-name>domain.com</domain-name> <broadcast-address>10.0.0.3</broadcast-address> <dns-servers>10.0.0.4,10.0.0.5</dns-servers> </lease-settings> <extensible-attributes> <attribute> <key>Building</key> <value>sample</value> </attribute> </extensible-attributes> </parameters> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
target[Conditional]: There are two ways in which this tag can be specified.
First Option: This tag can contain a dynamic target configuration. Following tags are applicable while defining a dynamic target.
host[Conditional]: Host name or IP address of Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
user-name[Conditional]: Username required to connect Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
password[Conditional]: The password associated with the <user-name> provided. Encrypted password can be provided by providing an "encryption-type" attribute. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets. Valid values for encryption-type are: Plain, Base64 Default value: Plain
timeout-secs[Optional] Specifies the time, in seconds, after which the attempt to connect to the Infoblox Grid Manager fails. Default value in seconds: 60
Second Option: This tag can refer to one of pre-defined target configurations of Infoblox Grid Manager on which the request will be executed.
Valid values: The value specified for <target> XML element must be same as the value that has been specified for the name attribute of <config> element in Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Default value: If this element is not provided or left empty, the request will be executed on the first defined Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Note: If no adapter configurations are specified while configuring the adapter dynamic target need to be defined under "target" tag.
network[Required] Specify the network or subnetwork. You can specify IPv4 or IPv6 address.
mask[Required] Specify the mask for the network.
disable[Optional] Disable the network after creation.
authority[Optional] Specify the authority of the network. Only applicable for IPv4 address
template[Optional] Use the specified template to create the network.
comment[Optional] Specify the user comment for the network.
extensible-attributes[Optional] Specify the extensible attributes for the network. E.g. Building, site etc.
lease-time[Optional] Specify the lease time.
routers[Optional] Specify the ip addresses of routers. Ip address should be seperated by comma. For example 10.0.0.1,10.0.0.2.
domain-name[Optional] Specify the domain name.
broadcast-address[Optional] Specify the broadcast address.
dns-servers[Optional] Specify the dns servers.
scheduled-at[Optional] Specify the date time on which operation need to be executed. Date and time are represented in ISO 8601 extended format (e.g., 2008-10-21T10:56:00Z or 2008-10-21T10:56:00.001Z) with some restrictions. When the scheduling parameter is used, changes do not occur immediately. Instead at the date time specified in this parameter.

documentation.description: Creates a new Network in InfoBlox Grid Manager.
